Reviews.Title: “Great price and location”
Reviews.Author: lizb128
Reviews.Content: When I first started looking at booking this hotel, I was a bit scared by some bad reviews, even though I also saw a lot of good ones. But we really needed a hotel with a convenient location to downtown and a low price, so I went ahead and booked it anyway. I'm glad I did! Yes, the hotel is old, and it's not the fanciest, but the room was clean, except for a couple of items under the bed forgotten by the previous guest. The beds were comfortable enough and we had plenty of clean towels, soap, and toilet paper. I do wish we could have had a fridge so we could bring back leftovers from the yummy restaurants we visited, but I'm not going to complain about that for the price we got. There is no breakfast included in the price. Although there is a cafe at the hotel, we got a delicious breakfast at Yolk every morning just down the street -- they are a little expensive but definitely worth it. We did not have a car, but every time we walked by the parking lot there were plenty of parking spots, even at night. We were here from a Saturday to a Thursday in March, and even on the weekend there were spots available. My biggest complaint is the noise at night -- the hotel is near some busy streets, so you get street noise. The doors to the rooms also slam, so you hear your neighbors' doors slamming at night. We had quite a bit of noise on Saturday night, but the other nights during the week weren't too bad. Also, the shower would get scalding hot for a few seconds at a time, then go back to normal. This happened to me every morning, but my friend showered at night and did not have this problem at all. Also, the WiFi did not work sometimes, although it did work OK about 80% of the time. Despite these incoveniences, I would definitely stay here again. You can't ask for a better price and location in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “What a perfect location !”
Reviews.Author: erixcyr
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Chicago for pleasure in October 2010 with my girlfriend for one week. I think this is a must do trip for everybody... what a wonderful city. During our week, after lots of on-line shopping and reading of reviews, we chose to stay at the downtown Chicago Howard Johnson. First off the price was very reasonnable compared to other downtown hotels. It was under 100$ a night and included a special which gave us a free night during the week. Another important factor was the free parking. In no other hotel of all downtown Chicago did I see free parking. Most will charge about 20$ (some even 30$) a night for parking. Obviously the rooms weren't as luxurious as other hotels, but this all depends on what you're looking for. During our week we were only in our room for sleeping and getting changed for the evening/supper time, otherwise we we're constantly on the go and visiting the many attractions that chicago has to offer. The room was well equiped but slightly old and out of date. A fresh coat of paint and a new carpet would make it look brand new. The location was incredible. Every morning we would set out for our day (always on foot). A few blocks to the south and you have your choice of Starbucks or Dunkin Donuts as well as access to the subway/elevated train. From there you could go anywhere in the city. Overall a great experience, and if we ever decide to go back to Chicago we'll definately check out the Howard Johnson again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: KMWCleveland_OH
Reviews.Content: A rather dingy, older motel in central Chicago. The good: great location, free Wi-Fi.The bad: 40 parking spaces for 70 rooms - you could be looking for parking at a neighborhood lot. They advertise "free parking" but don't say it is limited. Rooms are bare minimum. I almost scalded myself each morning for 3 days in the shower - water temp keeps changing. Ice machine broken. No mini-fridge. Older TV. 1 thin blanket. Towels not replaced.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beth-Clarkson
Reviews.Content: Good location. Clean Room and bathroom. Decent sized room with comfortable bed. What else do you need in a city where people go for shopping and visit sights not glued to their rooms/lobby/swimming pool?????

Reviews.Title: “Thoughts Upon Arrival: Oh god...”
Reviews.Author: Blake L
Reviews.Content: Upon approaching the hotel, I thought to myself, "Oh. My. God." and "This is why this place is only $50 a night"...I guess you get what you pay for...I was told there are 70 rooms but only 40 parking spots and that I should hurry up and get here so that I get a spot. Well...there are about 4 cars in the lot right now. Which made me initially question "Why is no one else here?" I would soon find out... Maybe the other potential guests had already discovered that many of the outer doors to the rooms DO NOT LOCK. Kind of a big deal as far as security goes...so that made me feel extremely unsafe, which is probably why I did not sleep very well. Then as the night went on, I began to hear teenagers and bar-goers outside walking past my window. (Oh yes, on the SECOND floor there is a balcony where anyone can walk past your window just as easily as on the first floor and since the outer doors do not lock it could be anyone walking out there, not just Howard Johnson guests.) I did not see any sort of security guard so I'm not sure where the other reviewers saw that guy unless he just happened to have the night off the night I'm here. Second most unpleasant part of the room, aside from the uneasiness, was the temperature. Though I immediately turned the heat on, I did not feel the temperature of the room rise any amount of degrees. I looked around for a quilt to solve this problem but all I found was an old thin moth-eaten blanket that didn't do the trick. I should have known you have to bring camping equipment to hotels...

Reviews.Title: “Never again THIS Howard Johnson”
Reviews.Author: mwh31
Reviews.Content: I thought I might be in trouble when I saw the uniformed security guard in the office that afternoon. I had wanted a downtown, not terribly expensive, "decent", place to stay near the wonderful mass transit system in Chicago. I send very little time in the room so to me decent meant clean, bed, TV, safe. Had bed, had TV, never felt safe, wasn't clean. Walking in room with socks I would STICK to the floor. Safe? Aside from THEM feeling they needed a guard 24/7, the window in the room was opaque, could not look out, did not open. NEVER, NEVER AGAIN. Oh, yes, the location was great, between the Brown and Red lines (two-three blocks in either direction) and not far from the bus line (51? 53?) I could take to my daughter's.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Susan H
Reviews.Content: Upon initial arrival, I thought this place looked more like a motel than a hotel, but this was in no way a problem. Thoughts: Location: This hotel is located near the purple, brown and red lines - all of which will take you downtown and to other places within the city. The trip to downtown is very close - 10-15 minutes. It is also a short walk to the Magnificent Mile where there is heaps of shopping and the Marilyn Monroe statue. It is also walking distance to the John Hancock building. Cleanliness: The doorways smelt of cigarette smoke, but the rooms themselves were fairly clean and smelt nice. The only thing was that there were some spots on the towels, but it wasn't a big problem. Service: This was the only part of the hotel that wasn't great. We wanted to book a taxi that was a van because we had a lot of luggage. The concierge told us that it was not necessary to book one because it would be extremely easy to hail one from the street. This would have been fine had we not needed a van. When we told her we specifically needed a van, she told us to look in the phone book for the cab number. Other: The wifi connection was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: JASON S
Reviews.Content: This place is ok. Its in a great location and has free parking. There are 70 rooms and 40 parking spots. Get there early and leave your car there and walk or use cta to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Price and location right for a two night stay”
Reviews.Author: AbbeyFlyer
Reviews.Content: The HJ is rather tired but perfectly ok for the price we paid which wasn't high compared with it's location. Room was clean, bed was comfortable and the desk staff were excellent, very helpful and informative. Breakfast in the cafe on site is well priced and agin the service was excellent. Easy to get to City Tour Bus and it is a short walk to the McD Rock and Roll Diner and a decent steak house. You need to watch out for the shoe cleaning scam if you are waiting for the Tour Bus. Just say no before he or she starts talking!

Reviews.Title: “Motel price. Hotel location.”
Reviews.Author: 4forNik
Reviews.Content: I knew that this was not going to be a suberb hotel. It was very old, clean tub and sinks, and a great location with free ample parking! I brought my 3 daughters aged 7-13 for a 2 night Chicago sightseeing trip. We were a 15 minute stroll from Hancock Center and Water Tower Place (which houses American Girl), 7 minutes from Magnificent Mile, and we took an $11 dollar cab ride to Shedd Aquarium and the Museum Campus and the return trip was the same. The free parking is a bonus, and great chain restaurants are blocks away. If you are looking for cheap, "it'll do" accomodations, go for it. But for a luxurious getaway to feel pampered, this is not your place.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: carrotsWirral
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days in early October, and as it was so cheap compared to other hotels we'd seen we weren't expecting much, but it was in a good location, fairly quiet, and secure. It was clean and comfortable. The air conditioning unit was pre-historic so was a bit noisy when we were trying to sleep, and the windows weren't exactly big and bright, but in a city like this I think this would be pretty standard. Of the five hotels on our trip (the others all a lot more pricey) this was the only one which had tea/coffee making facilities in the room. There was no safe.The entrance hall smelt a bit musty, but the room was fine! It is a very 'motel' style and we chose a first floor rather than ground floor (there are only 2 floors) and I would recommend that for peace and quiet. It was smaller than it looks in the photos but that wasn't necessarily a bad thing. Overall good value for money, and I would stay there again if I was on a budget. Although I've marked it as average it was good (just not quite a very good!).

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: tpgodfrey
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights in Chicago and the hotel was great. Its older but we had one King size bed and Tv and clean bathroom. We were up stairs and we had 3 of the rooms upstairs which was nice cause we could visit from room to room. Felt very safe since you had to have a key to get in the downstairs door before going up stairs to your room. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The restaurant at the hotel was really good we had breakfast there every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Run down and In Need Of a Remodel”
Reviews.Author: railfanMichigan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on October 3rd for 1 night. While the Room was modern and nice comfy bed flatscreen tv The rest of the hotel is run down. THERE IS NO ELEVATOR AT ALL. To get the rooms you have to walk up 1 set of stairs then across a open area then another set of stairs just to get to the rooms. Its like this hotel used to be a run down motel and they converted it into a hotel. It needs allot of work. The personal were nice but the hotel needs to be re-modeled big time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: FlamingoChuck
Reviews.Content: This HoJo Inn is the true definition of value. It is an older hotel - the motel of family vacations when I was a child - complete with free parking (amazing in Chicago) and free WiFi. The staff is small but incredibly helpful, the rooms are basic & a bit worn but very clean. A king suite is one large room with a couch, desk, mini fridge, microwave & sink. The prices are far lower than other hotels in the area. There are two El lines within a short walk (brown is one block, red is 4 blocks). The little on-site coffee shop is a gem - wonderful breakfast & VERY friendly, fast service - even on a Sunday AM when local restaurants had long lines. We were very pleasantly surprised and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Good location Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Rob P
Reviews.Content: This location is close to what you need. Just 6 blocks to Michigan Ave. The place could use some updating but everything worked and was clean. The front counter folks were helpful as well. I would book again

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dawgman51
Reviews.Content: A great location close to the Mag Mile and public transportation! The price was right and NO parking fees. The desk staff was GREAT giving info, advice, and being very helpful The room is small, there was no mattress pad and the flat sheets on the mattress easily came off. Who knows what was on the mattress left from previous guests. I would spend more money and look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Decent property with FREE parking!!”
Reviews.Author: MotorCityFan
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this property several times. It definitely could use renovations, but for the price and location it works for me. For as much time as we actually spend in our room while in Chicago - Howard Johnson Inn is typically our first choice. There is a decent diner attached that is good and inexpensive. The location is within walking distance to most, if not all, of the places that we like to frequent. Close to public transportation. Rooms are clean and decent and I feel safe at this property!

Reviews.Title: “National Train Day Weekend in Chicago...”
Reviews.Author: Choo-Choo
Reviews.Content: I wanted to spend a weekend in Chicago in conjunction with Amtrak's annual National Train Day. Thanks to Priceline, my successful bid was accepted by the Howard Johnson, which, coincidentally, was one of the hotels I was considering due to its location and proximity to public transportation. This facility was definitely an older, no-frills, motel-like hotel, with small rooms, no microwaves or refrigerators in the rooms, no handicapped accessibility, or free breakfast. The rooms are clean and comfortable, and the staff was friendly. The best thing about this hotel is location, location, location. From the hotel, it is about a 5-minute walk west to the CTA Brown Line, or a 10-minute walk east to the CTA Red Line. And you could easily walk to LOTS of retail establishments. All in all, a good place to stay in the Windy City.

Reviews.Title: “clean comfortable and FREE parking”
Reviews.Author: northsouthq
Reviews.Content: Other recent reviewers have touched on most of the basics here so I'll keep this short. Very pleasant stay, picked this hotel for free parking and convenient location and was not disappointed in the least. It's not fancy but I don't need fancy, just clean and a decent place to come home to after exploring Chicago. The free parking is a definite plus and the staff was very friendly and helpful also. Wifi worked fine. I was here for 4 nights in mid-August. Never felt unsafe either, the neighborhood seems decent and they have a security guard around all night too. The nightly rate was extremely reasonable. Very pleased, thank you Hojo!!

Reviews.Title: “Great family stay!”
Reviews.Author: TJH22
Reviews.Content: I have never felt compelled to write a review, but after staying at the hotel I realized there were some unfair reviews. We had a great experience and received friendly helpful service from the manager and staff. This is a great location with clean comfortable rooms. You can get better rooms, but not the great deal that includes on site free controlled parking. The location was near everything and we felt safe the entire stay. What really struck me was when the manager during check in said that if anything was not right he would take care of it immediately. We had no problems and the room had cold air conditioning and a strong shower. The beds were fresh and comfortable. If you are visiting Chicago and are seeing the city, this is the best deal I found. My family will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A basic motel, room clean, hotel exterior and corridors a bit offputting”
Reviews.Author: suzanne r
Reviews.Content: Staff helpful, room basic - very large bed and TV, air con. Frosted window on ours so couldn't see daylight - was odd. Needs coffee facilities. Broken can machine, told to ring up as it swallowed our money! Really good value for the centre of Chicago, especially with free parking and WiFi. Great value and tasty diner attached for breakfast. Misleading photograph on website, it doesn't look anything like that. It's a bit scruffy looking in reality, the corridors are hot, smelly and carpeted all over the place. The room in contrast is clean, spacious and fine for a budget hotel. Location excellent - everything in walking distance - 10 mins max from Oak Street Beach which was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “I'd be back”
Reviews.Author: navinohraduCZ
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family only for one night as I had to wait for my bus connection. However I enjoyed my stay and everything was very clean. Enough towels, good TV channels selection and the most important for me - not far away from Union station. I'd definitely recommend it as a low cost stay option with decent accommodation and free Internet access. Sleep quality rated 3/5 - it's in downtown so it's kinda noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay”
Reviews.Author: fivecallmemom
Reviews.Content: OK so the hotel isn't a 4, 5 or even 3 star and they don't claim to be. So I figured how much time are we going to spend in a hotel anyway? What we wanted was a clean place to sleep, reasonably priced, close to the things we wanted to do and a place to park my car. That is exactly what we got. Sure the rooms could be updated a bit. A little repair here or there might be nice too. But after the great customer service I received ALL of that was over looked. We felt safe, and I was traveling with 2 teenaged girls. We slept comfortably and had nice hot showers and walked to nearby eateries - and the bus stop was 1 block away. We had a blast. Thank you to Daisy who literally showed us where to go to even get bus passes! And the pizza she recommended was wonderful. So the hotel isn't the best in Chicago - but we were able to enjoy the best of Chicago = it's people!!!!

Reviews.Title: “An honest review”
Reviews.Author: p4kgal
Reviews.Content: Many of the reviews I read before staying at the"HoJo," as my friends and I dubbed it, left me scared and dreading my brief stay at the hotel while I was in the city for 3 days at the P4k Festival. One person wrote there were bedbugs, one person wrote that the hotel rooms were disgustingly unkempt, and one went as far as saying it was in a bad neighborhood. None of these things ended up being true in the slightest. The HoJo gets a bad rap. I'm not saying it's the Hilton, but it's not a cardboard box in an alley, which is what some people would like you to believe. CONS -Thin walls. We had a shared door with our neighbors who on the first night were a family with an endless bounty of screaming children refusing to go to bed. The second night it was a group of friends who partied into the wee hours of the morning. This made it hard to sleep for some of the people in the room. -I didn't like that there weren't any fitted sheets. My boyfriend tends to toss and turn in his sleep and more than once he woke up sleeping on the mattress. Personal preference. PROS -Location, location, location. The neighborhood is safe and within walking distance of many attractions. Example, the bf and I walked to the Lincoln Park Zoo one day in under 30 minutes. My friends and I walked to the 7-Eleven many times at night without any problems, even without the boys around. There's also lots of good eateries that are inexpensive around the area as well. It's very easy to get a cab if you need to too. -Despite having to book a smoking room even though none of us smoke, the room was very clean. Sure, there were some scuffs on the walls and someone's faded name written near the floor in the bathroom and it smelled like cigs, it was all very clean. Again due to the horror story reviews I mistakenly believed (I assume the people who wrote them were over the age of 40, at least it seemed that way) there would be bedbugs and blood smeared on the wall. This wasn't the case. Maybe I'm more tolerant because I'm in my early 20s, but I didn't think it was so bad. -Free parking also ruled. Just get there early because it's first come, first serve. You won't find a cheaper place to stay downtown. If you're poor like me and only staying for a few days the HoJo will do.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget option in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Leotie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room at the Howard Johnson for a four-night summer weekend visit to Chicago. We were pleased with the experience--the friendly staff, convenient location and basic-but-adequate accommodations met our needs. There are certainly plenty of luxury full-service hotels in Chicago. HoJo is where you stay if you want a good place to sleep. This motel is fun and retro--two stories, no common area other than a tiny lobby, and a tasty and cheap diner (LaSalle Cafe Luna) with excellent service. Some of the furnishings looked a little dated and the wifi was slow in our room, but we had a comfortable bed, cold A/C and a good shower. I noticed our sink drained slowly the first two nights, but it was promptly fixed without us having to ask. We traveled with other friends, and our group booked four rooms in all. The place was a hit with everyone--it is close to the el train, offers one free (!) parking space per room and one larger group got a big room with two sinks. My room was pretty small, but it was fine for the two of us. Besides being close to public transportation and plenty of cabs, the motel is a short walk to the Magnificent Mile area and lots of touristy restaurants like Fogo de Chao, Ed Debeviks, Rainforest Cafe and the (formerly called?) rock 'n' roll McDonald's. I was a little hesitant after reading some negative reviews, but if you manage your expectations you will be happy you stayed at the downtown HoJo.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Hotel in A Nice Area”
Reviews.Author: Dan717
Reviews.Content: The room was good sized, a little old but not smelly or anything. Considering how much your paying its all that you could expect. I felt safe in the area and they had some cool bars around (just follow the music). There is an affordable diner located next to the hotel, The food was delicious and the portions were large. Only problem was they only stay open till 5 so its a good breakfast or lunch spot. This hotel is a great value considering the location, Its good for those on a budget, especially for younger people looking to pack a room and save cash. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. O and almost forgot parking and WIFI are both free here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Clean, Friendly”
Reviews.Author: bleedblue115
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in July. The staff was very friendly, making our stay hassle free. Had a king size room which was smaller than an average hotel room but still left us with plenty of room. Room & sheets were clean. Actually this hotel was cleaner then a lot of other hotels i have stayed at. Rooms are separated into blocks of 6 with a security door for each block. Didn't run into any noise issues but I would imagine it could be a problem if you have noisy neighbors. Overall a fantastic value. Close to many food options, the red line, shops, about 9 blocks to the pier and lake. Will stay here again. Thanks for a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: smartywishbone
Reviews.Content: We were quite worried prior to going to this hotel given some of the negative reviews of this place on Trip Advisor. But it was really good value. We couldn't change our minds anyway as we had booked through Hotwire but luckily we didn't want to. This Hotel costs about half as much as those barely 5- 10 minutes walk away up on the mag mile. There are great food options quite near by and the little diner at the place is great for breakfast. This Diner is not conected with the hotel. It is easy to get to the train (red line) but it is also easy to walk if you have the time and energy. The rooms have free wifi, are clean and quite spacious. The Only thing is you are reasonably close to the other guests. We didn't have a problem but if the neighbours get rowdy you will know about it. I would stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to Leave!”
Reviews.Author: beye2960
Reviews.Content: first things first, i can say the people were friendly, my friend and I came to stay here for a small Chicago vacation, and had never stayed there before, we ate at Pappadeaux that night which btw is AMAZING! but anyways we wanted to bring food back but wasnt sure if we had a fridge, we called and the lady at the front desk who proceeded to upgrade us to a suite for free! which was nice and we were excited till we got into the room. 1. there is one elevator, and it only goes to one of three parts of the hotel, us being in the "suites" i figured we'd have a frickin elevator, but guess what no, so after carrying like 5 bags up the stairs, we wanted to relax. The sheets were dirty. and had stains. Gross, and they had no fitted sheets. 2. The tv that looks like it's 15 yrs old, didnt work, we called the front desk and the woman sent the "security guard" to fix it. he couldnt, so no tv. 3.Then we went to the vending machine, which was an adventure in itself, the whole floor of the suites smelled of drugs, the people in the next room we're smoking it up. 4. I fixed the tv at least, but much to say i will never stay here again. 5. the brown curtains were very nice (sarcastic).

Reviews.Title: “A no frills place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sbraith
Reviews.Content: This is a classic 70's HoJo in every sense of the word. It's a bare-bones, no - nonsense place to crash with comfortable beds, free wifi and great greasy-spoon right in the building. If you're looking to spend any time in the room, look elsewhere. If you want a clean, safe, comfortable place to park your car, drop your luggage and catch a few zzzzz's than this is perfect. The staff was excellent, our room was fine, plenty of hot water, fresh towels and an air conditioner that was loud as hell but worked like a charm. Walking distance to the miracle mile and the city beaches. Perfect for the budget traveler who wants to explore downtown on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Holy Showers”
Reviews.Author: fawn-sf
Reviews.Content: Doing Chicago on a budget, HOJO seemed like prime real estate in comparison to the bevy of shi-shi hotels that make up the bulk of downtown vacationing. It puts you in nice walkable distance to a slew of staple buildings and public transportation. Considering I spent more time getting out of the downtown area than staying in it, it wasn't the smartest selection. Aside from the low prices (which don't really strike me as low, considering rates were hovering around $125+), the free parking and the obvious location placement - this joint is pretty much a dump. Okay, Okay. At the end of the day I really only need a bed, a bathroom and free wi-fi, but realtalk? None of that made up for the stained walls, lousy drains, bath nobs that were more of a workout to maneuver than ever should be - and my favorite - holes in the shower curtains. Seriously? You can't afford to purchase a plastic shower curtain for a buck or two? The scrawling of "#3" in indelible marker on the curtain really took the cake. Because holy curtains are of serious importance as they must must must end up on the proper room. Yes. There is an obvious musty stench. Yes the rooms are barely subpar. Yes the front door slams so noisily it's nearly impossible to sleep through it. I'll say the staff was nice and helpful. The adjacent diner is literally the epitome of diner food for diner prices, but that's the point right? If they painted the walls, befriended Febreze, updated minor details in furnishing and fixed door hinges this place would be a steal. IF they charged no more than 70 bones a night. But, alas, that ain't the case. So, take it for what it's worth. A whole lotta nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Katie13
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I stayed here on a weekend/Spring Break trip to Chicago for 3 nights. We initially booked the reservation online at a fixed rate (that I didn't notice until later) and closer to our trip found a cheaper rate. I called the hotel and the manager adjusted the rate for the last night of our stay (which was a Friday and more expensive) to match the other two nights, making the savings within dollars of each other if we had booked at the cheaper rate online. I really appreciated his service and was impressed. The location can't be beat unless you want to spend an arm and a leg on a hotel room. the room itself was kind of small but the size of the bathrooms made up for it! I also liked that there was a "security door" that led to groups of rooms, it made the area feel much safer. Having an enclosed parking lot was very nice as well. Beds were really nice for the price we paid and the hotel was clean and orderly.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel accommodation I have experienced in over 30 years of holidays.”
Reviews.Author: CoupleFromWiltshire
Reviews.Content: After experiencing a wonderful 10 day cruise of Alaska, we checked into this hotel after a fairly hectic day of travelling from San Francisco to Chicago. Absolutely disgusting is the only way I can describe the hotel room allocated to us. I have chosen my words carefully in referring to the room rather than hotel because I note there are other previews which are fairly positive (and for the life of me, I cannot understand). The hotel looked like a really old fashioned "L" shaped Motel on two levels. The type you see on TV where you book in then drive up to your room. Two levels in blocks assigned A, B, C etc., and each block with eight rooms, four facing front and four facing back. Our room was 2B on the lower level facing the back. This was our fifth stop-over on a 17 day holiday so although our first impression was not good, we decided that maybe the hectic day was making us over react. To explain all the background to discussions with reception etc., would take too long so I have attempted just list the bullet points covering the positives and negatives: POSITIVES: 1. The little diner attached to the hotel was really good. Spotless clean, very helpful and friendly staff, very good food (breakfast on 2 days) and excellent service and prices. NEGATIVES: 1. The room was dingy, badly lit (one of the two bedside lights not working), small and crowded due to a huge old fashioned TV and cabinet in one corner. In daylight the following morning we realised the room was truly a dump - the decor looked like it hadn't seen a lick of pain in years, curtains were ancient, filthy and marked (although they certainly kept the light out), the carpet was stained and looked filthy. 2. The bedroom window was opaque glass so we couldn't see through. They opened about a foot from either side and looked out on to a back alley hosting two big bins. The window was covered with a metal mesh frame to protect from??? 3. Vagrants/homeless people obviously slept in the back alley. At 11pm first night someone was chapping at the window through the mesh wire asking if we could spare a dollar. Following day I mentioned this to reception and they said we should have reported it and they would have sent security to investigate. I asked; "didn't security patrol to try ensure guests don't get disturbed?" They had no answer. 3. After being away for most of the day we returned to our room around 10:30pm to discover it hadn't been made up. Reception offered to move us to another room but that was it. We didn't want to pack up and move at that time of night so I went to reception and collected fresh towels. 4. The hotel had the nerve to have a banner outside which read "newly renovated". On questioning this a fellow guest suggested that this might refer to a newer block of rooms at the end of the Motel. Indeed there was a newer block but this was never offered or mentioned to us. SUMMARY Honestly, this is the worst hotel experience I have ever had. I am not in the habit of writing previews but felt that I had to report on this one. This was supposed to be a special holiday but this experience tarnished it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: 1byrd
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week. Room was surprisingly quiet, well appointed, comfortable. Staff was very friendly and knowledgeable about area sites. On-site cafe was perfect for quick breakfast or nice salad. Don't expe4ct Four Seasons - but for te eprice this HoJo was fantastic, outstanding, superior!!

Reviews.Title: “Bargain!”
Reviews.Author: racheljxx
Reviews.Content: Great location, 5min walk from michigan Avenue, 5min walk to where my sister lives. Basic room but very clean & comfortable. Was unsure when booking this motel but pleasently suprised! Only thing missing was a mirror in the room rather than x2 in the bathroom, no good when two people are trying to get ready!

Reviews.Title: “Palmer Inn Hilton next time”
Reviews.Author: KarenAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Although recently renovated, the place still looks worn (would not want to see what it looked like before..). All of us slept well, so I guess the beds were new. Friendly, helpful staff. Neighborhood ok. We could have stayed at the Palmer Inn Hilton for the same price, had we been able to shift our dates a few days. That is what we'll do next time for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but convenient”
Reviews.Author: Peter Mills
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Howard Johnson Inn at the end of our long holiday in the US. First impressions were not good as the hotel/motel is rather shabby looking, despite the large banner hung outside reading 'recently refurbished'. If this is so, I would hate to have seen it before! The communal areas were tatty with scuffed paintwork and stained carpets. It all felt a bit threatening, although we had no particular safety problems. The rooms were serviceable but unimpressive, with quite an old TV and cigarette burns on the bedspread (counterpane). I was not very imressed with the room cleanliness either as there were spiders webs on the walls and long female hairs in the bathroom, which all remained, despite the room being 'cleaned'. On the plus side, the staff seemed friendly and the hotel/motel is is a good location - easily walkable from the loop and most of the downtown attractions. Given the choice I would probably choose to stay somewhere more upmarket next time we visit Chicago (which is a beautiful city!).

Reviews.Title: “No Frills, but OK and inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: AmyPGH123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Howard Johnson's on N. LaSalle on May 17th. It wasn't our choice (contest winner for Oprah Farewell Spectacular show), and at first, we were very apprehensive after reading the reviews on TA. We stayed in one of the suites, and the room was clean, with a microwave, coffee maker, and mini fridge. The one outstanding aspect was the staff. We had a lamp that wasn't working, and they came up in what seemed like seconds to fix it. The manager even lent us his umbrella to do a little shopping. The staff is definitely friendly and attentive. My only complaint was that the water pressure in the shower was horrible, and the temperature seemed to fluctuate. The toilet took two flushes every time to properly flush. Beyond that, if you are looking for a clean, basic, no frills hotel with a great staff and a great location, you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: Zloto
Reviews.Content: This is certainly a no-frills hotel. However, it's close to Michigan Avenue, close to the buses and L trains,and in a perfectly OK area. Despite other reviews, I found it clean and comfortable for my needs. My one complaint about the room was the slightly antiquated air-conditioning, which only seemed to have one working setting - 'fan only'. If you are visiting Chicago and want somewhere cheap and cheerful, you could do far worse than this HJ hotel. I took a risk by taking advantage of the 'stay 3 nights, get 30% off'' rate, and didn't regret it. Some advice for the reception staff - try and bone up on tourist information, especially where to get buses and trains. "Get a cab" shouldn't really be the deafult answer to every such question! Also, have some proper city maps available.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: SunshineNSTL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very excited about being an audience guest on the Oprah show. We arrived in Chicago at 12:30 am and had to be at Harpo Studio at 6:00 so we were anticipating being a little tired but we had no idea what we were walking in to. We stayed in E3. It was deplorable. The carpet in the hall leading to the room was horrid. The room looked ok at first glance; old but doable for 1 night. I pulled the covers back and the sheet was DIRTY. The chair I almost sat in when I called the front desk was so dirty it made my skin crawl. I went into the bathroom and the towels were dirty. I was totally DISGUSTED! Because of the time, and several nearby hotels were sold out, we laid the 1 clean sheet they brought us on top of everything and turned the heat on full blast. We slept in our clothing and could not wait till morning to get out of there! I took lots of pictures and sent them along with an e-mail to Customer Care. It's been 10 days and they still have not called me back however, I noticed yesterday that they refunded me the $114.00 I paid for the hotel. I will NEVER stay there again! I was COMPLETELY DISGUSTED by this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very acceptable and a great bargain.”
Reviews.Author: BigQReports
Reviews.Content: I am in town for a meeting at the Hyatt, about a 20-25 minute walk. I have stayed 4 nights. Overall, I have been very pleased. Granted the place does not look very modern on the outside but inside the rooms are fine. I have a single king size bed that is comfortable. My window is opaque so I can't see outside. I don't have a car but the sign in the lobby claims free parking. However, they say there are only 41 spots for 71 rooms, up to one car per room. So if you leave your spot you may not get it back. I see nearby parking lots for $15-18 dollars for 24 hours. I got a great price of $69 by agreeing that the room would be unrefundable; I booked 5 months in advance. This was by far the best price of any Chicago downtown hotel. The Ohio hotel is a few blocks away and I believe that was also inexpensive, maybe $99. The room comes with free wi-fi; it works well. If you consider the free wi-fi and the free parking, you end up with a very good deal. The Hyatt charges $14 per day for wi-fi and parking I believe is close to $30 per day. My bathroom is small but comfortable. There is a combination shower/tub. Caution: the toilets have an industrial style handle (tankless) and the flush would probably wash down a whole grapefruit. So....(1) don't flush while still sitting down, and (2) when someone else in the building flushes the shower partially looses cold water press and you can get momentarily scalded if you have the water set for very hot. Please keep this in mind, especially if you have young children or very elderly adults who are taking showers. BE careful and don't set the water too hot. The rooms are spread out over several buildings. Most are 1-2 floors, one building is 3 floors. I mention this because you will hear street noise in the morning because you are close to street level in all rooms. I imagine very tall hotels would not have this problem. I brought a white noise machine that helped a lot. The location is convenient to much of downtown Chicago IF you don't mind walking. I can reach Navy Pier in about 30 minutes, but I am a fast walker. My room has a cathode ray TV and a coffee maker and a very nice desk and also a lounge chair. The room smells fine with no bad odors or musty smell. Check in was 4:00; I arrived very early but they would not let me check in until 3:00. However, they allowed me to leave my bags and wander about the city. I used Go Express shuttle service to get here from the airport ($30). No refrigerator or microwave in the room. There is an ice machine so if you brought a cooler you could keep a few things cold overnight. Two blocks away is the biggest and most amazing McDonalds I have ever seen. About 4-5 blocks away is a Trader Joes. Two blocks away is a Walgreens. Dozens of restaurants in walking distance. I am very happy and would stay here again. I am a cheapskate so I was very pleased to get this room for so little and with free wi-fi to boot.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: dtyler10
Reviews.Content: We went up to Chicago for one day. We wanted to stay somewhere near downtown at a place that was relatively reasonable in price for a downtown hotel. So we get there and I see that this building hasn't been fixed up on the outside since the late 50's and early 60's. The room was gross. In my room, I found not one but two bedsheets with stains on them. One of them appeared to be in the shape of a hand. This was gross. The bathroom had no vent fan rather this heating fan that made my bathroom experience very miserable and hot. We asked for new bed sheets so they send up their security guard that seemed to be high out of his mind and let us get new bed sheets hesitantly. After a while I noticed something on the floor. It was the top of a wine bottle. So I tried to sleep on the bed there but then I noticed the pillows had some hair on them. It looked like the pillow covers were not washed well or at all. I ended up sleeping on an air mattress for the night.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Dissapointed Since Last Stay”
Reviews.Author: BTCompKSU
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last year and had no problems (see review from April '10). This time, however, was a bit different. When we arrived, I quickly realized that there was no public restroom. We checked into our non-smoking room only to find that the toilet was not functioning properly. The front desk informed us that there was no maintenance personal on duty, but offered us a plunger to try and fix the problem, which we attempted unsuccessfully. After moving us into a smoking room (the only one available), we settled in. The hotel is definitely dated, but seemed clean on the surface. However, a check of the sheets discovered that they were very worn and looked to possibly be stained. We asked for new sheets but were told none were available. After some persuasion, we convinced the hotel to escort us back to our original room where we could collect the sheets from the other beds. Other than this incident we slept relatively comfortably. This hotel offers free parking in the center of downtown Chicago, which is it's main draw. After complaining to the front desk about the problems we experienced during the stay, they did allow us to leave our car in the free lot for the entire day after checking out. (saving us parking fees somewhere else). Overall, the staff did the best they could to accommodate us given the resources they had available to them and it all worked out in the end. However, based on this experience, I am going to have a hard time staying with this property again. For downtown Chicago on a tight budget, this is your place. But you get what you pay for. Note: There is a cash only diner attached to the property and a pricey two-floor themed McDonald's within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, within walking distance to everything”
Reviews.Author: mrrussellcoight
Reviews.Content: Honestly we arrived here late in the evening and it was difficult to gauge the neighbourhood and at first look we were a little concerned. The rooms were basic but very clean and the bathroom was recently updated. For the value no one in their right mind should or could complain about staying at this hotel, it has free wifi and parking, within walking distance to plenty of tourist sights, excellent dining and the magnificent mile.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable but no frills”
Reviews.Author: gwynn44
Reviews.Content: For a budget motel in a great location 6 blocks from Michigan Avenue, this is good value. The room was clean, the bed comfortable, the TV had adequate channels. he decor was rather tired and the power sockets a bit wobbly but the coffeemaker was good and bathroom sparkling clean. And there's a great diner right beside reception that's open for breakfast and lunch, with a great menu and excellent friendly service. Also an excellent range of order-in menus from nearby restaurants. Reception staff were helpful and pleasant. All in all, a satisfactory experience.

Reviews.Title: “Drop your jaw hotel”
Reviews.Author: Toodles819
Reviews.Content: When my group and I arrived at the hotel, we had dropped jaws, and "wtfs!". First thing to remember, the picture of the hotel you see on theinternet, is the best view you can get, becasue it barely even shows the hotel. I got into my room and insepcted for bed bugs, which there wasn't, but there was a large satin on my sheet that looked like washed blood. I asked a maid if we could get a new sheet in our room, and she handed me a sheet to change it myself. The rooms are not places you want to stay in unless you're sleeping. The hallway carpets have many stains, and the stairwells are not even at that standard. ON the plus side though, the front desk staff were quite helpful, and the location is good. ...You decide!

Reviews.Title: “gotta love the moldy bathroom”
Reviews.Author: sammy699
Reviews.Content: If you love musty smell of mold spores in the morning this is the place to stay. If you have never experinced a water bed bath tub you have to check out room 214. The funny part is even the renovation sign was falling apart.. Was a great joke during the trip though.. Aparently a renovation is a new vanity and a shower insert with tons of caulk. Hey if you cannot make it to your bathroom feel free to urinate in the stairway everbody else has, the smell makes it obvious. I will say the only thing this place has going for it is the location and the front desk lady who was very helpful. The website photos are pretty funny to look at after our stay..

Reviews.Title: “Dump in a Boom boom Motel”
Reviews.Author: mike39517
Reviews.Content: We made reservations 3 months ago and asked for 2 rooms with 2 beds for 4 guys. When we got there the lady clerk said she only had two king rooms and no roll a ways. She said it was our problem not hers! the manager was off and would not be back till Monday. The rooms were old and bed bugs on our bed. We called Hotwire and they got us out of the room and found us a better place down the road with 2 beds in each room. Our cabbie said this place was a boom boom motel, wher the women come and boom boom they are gone in an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Super Cheap Hotel Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: waslka21
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 2 different times. Can't beat the price!!! Paid $80 for a room with a king size bed. The room looked like it had been recently remodeled and was clean. Location is great! Walking distance to Michigan Ave and tons of restaurants. Bonus: FREE PARKING (first come first serve for guests of the hotel). Only downside is that it did not have a fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great price for Chicago”
Reviews.Author: ricklangley
Reviews.Content: Tried quite a few other tourist type hotels first but were all fully booked. I found out later it was the weekend of the Chicago Marathon! The HoJo was the only reasonably priced place it could get in and I was a bit apprehensive having read some of the negative reviews. In fact the place was absolutely fine. I had a newly decorated room which was off a lobby away from the car park, so nice and quiet. I wasn't driving, but I should have thought free parking in downtown Chi was worth a bomb. There's a coffee shop on site which I didn't use and a spectacular MacDonalds a couple of blocks away which is well worth seeing. Red Line metro about ten minutes walk away which was useful. The desk staff were very friendly and helpful. Overall I was well impressed and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible smell of smoke and centipedes crawling over ceiling!”
Reviews.Author: Notapplicable50226
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a recent trip to Chicago and booked the Howard Johnson for it's location. We were troubled by the terrible smell of tobacco and pot smoke emanating from the next room. Although we had a non-smoking room, the room next door (which had a connecting door) allowed smoke to fill our room. We woke up several times from the smell and our upper airways were congested the following morning. There were also centipedes crawling all over the ceiling. This experience was, suffice it to say, subpar. The only recommendation is the proximity to the downtown/Magnificent Mile and subways and the ability to park your car for free. Other than that, I would recommend finding another place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: TishaJacobe
Reviews.Content: I am sitting here in my king size bed in my room in Howard Johnson Downtown Chicago, enjoying peace and quiet after a long day in Chicago. Ok so the hotel kind of has that Grandma's house smell and is not fancy AT ALL. The room is pretty comfortable but I would suggest you bring your own pillows cause the ones here suck! Other than that the bathroom is small but its a really good hotel for the price you pay! We got here around 11 at night and was able to get a free parking spot with no problems at all. Check in was quick and easy. If you are just in need of a place to sleep while you explore Chicago I would highly recommend this place. The rock and roll McDonalds is a five minute walk from here as well as the Hard Rock Cafe and Lou Malnati's on Wells. The Chicago river is about a 10 minute walk and Navy Pier about a half hour. Really good central location and perfect for travellers on a budget. Only wish they had a pool...

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, but great value”
Reviews.Author: zsazsa-stl
Reviews.Content: This hotel met all of our needs. It was easy to find, easy walk to public transportation (four blocks from the red line, two blocks from purple & brown), FREE parking (unheard of in Chicago), clean, quiet and safe. The facade, lobby and diner hold (some) mid-century charm, but our room was was shabby and generic. Our room faced the alley and had only one small, frosted window, but we were more than happy to trade in some amenities for the money we saved. We didn't come to Chicago to hang out in the hotel anyway. More money in our pockets to eat & shop! Note that there are more rooms than parking spots. We didn't have a trouble getting a spot despite being told that the hotel was completely booked while we were there. Several spots are even covered. There are several good restaurants in the neighborhood that were an easy walk. We especially enjoyed breakfast a few mornings at Yolk, just one block north on Wells. We would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Dump”
Reviews.Author: MrsBeasley18
Reviews.Content: The Howard Johnson brand just lost all credibility with me and my family. I will never stay in one again if this is what to expect. Supposedly, it was newly renovated, which meant that they tried to cover up huge holes, cracks and water marks in the ceiling and walls, but didn't succeed. Two of the outlets in the room didn't work. Pay-per-view didn't work (which we had to find out by calling the main desk after many futile attempts.) The hallways smelled like stale BO. This was the worst hotel I have ever been in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, not all rooms are renovated”
Reviews.Author: Mint D
Reviews.Content: undeniable perfect location hence price tag but we book the room because it advertises for the newly renovated room. Well we did not get one! come early to ensure parking.

Reviews.Title: “Just can't beat it!”
Reviews.Author: Italophile
Reviews.Content: First know that this is a Howard Johnson--so nothing fancy. I don't ask much when I visit a city like Chicago because I know I'll be out sightseeing lots. The rooms are clean & secure. The location is great--between 2 El stops (Brown line & Red line each about 2 blocks). The hotel has FREE parking, and this is what really makes it a great bargain in a city where it costs $45 for your car (though parking is not guaranteed once they reach capacity)! The Luna Cafe is good for breakfast (they serve other food too but we've only had breakfast there). The maids do a good job of cleaning, & the front desk is always very helpful. We stay here each year when we travel to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “not upscale but the location is perfect”
Reviews.Author: gydnew
Reviews.Content: Negatives - funky room smell, uncomfortable beds, wifi was spotty, bathroom was tiny, no breakfast Positives - free parking! great location! great price! If you are more focused on the sightseeing than a great hotel experience this is the place to stay. With a 3 day Go Chicago Card and a 3 day metro pass we spent more time out of the room than in the room. Bring your own pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the money”
Reviews.Author: duaneoftheozarks
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights while visiting Chicago. I stayed here because of the relatively cheap price, but mostly because it had free parking. We arrived at about 11 pm, and the parking lot was chained off, so I was worried we'd have to find somewhere else to park. Thankfully, they found one more parking spot way in the back. The next morning I was able to move the car to a better location. The outside of this motel looks a little beat, but the rooms were clean, wireless internet worked fine, the bed was really comfortable, and the room was quiet. It wasn't right downtown but close enough to walk or take a bus or taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Save money, park free, sleep well in shabby, funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: retired-teacher60
Reviews.Content: You must be able to go with the flow to stay here. It is not the Hilton. That said, it has to be one of the best deals in town. We stayed 3 nights and were thereby eligible for a special rate of $76/night. Breakfast was not included. There is a diner adjacent to the property that had good, reasonably priced breakfasts, however. Parking was free! You also get Wyndham rewards points. The rooms were shabby and very 1970's, but comfortable and very quiet. If you leave your "do not distub" sign out, the maid will not make up your room. Bus lines are nearby. Be sure to buy a pass that works for buses and subways. We were directed by the staff to Giordano's pizza nearby and it was fabulous. I was very pleased with the hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a dump.”
Reviews.Author: kayp1964
Reviews.Content: This place is not renovated, its a dump. Been staying at hojo for 18 years never again hello holiday inn.

Reviews.Title: “Top-Lage”
Reviews.Author: vatikano1
Reviews.Content: have stayed here 2 nights. If you look for an inexpensive place at a central location, then this is the place for you. The room is your standard motel room . Parking is free, and while I was there finding a free spot was never a problem.The free internet was a nice bonus, though it wasn't 100% reliable in our room

Reviews.Title: “can walk to just about everything”
Reviews.Author: kell518
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. Room was clean and location was great. Front desk was very helpful with directions. On the day of check out, we were going to Wrigleys Filed- was not sure if we would be back by noon. The front desk said that if we running late to call and just as long as were back by 1230pm it would be OK!! There is a small diner that will deliver to your room-did not try it. Nothing fancy but I didn't go to Chicago to stay in the hotel room. It is very affordable!! House keeping staff was nice-when I saw her in the hall and needed more items she was very accomadating. If I go back to chicago I know where I am staying again!! They will hold on to your bags before and after check in.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Improvement! Recently Renovated!”
Reviews.Author: Momtoexchangestudent
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel last year and was marginally happy at that time. It was a place to sleep, ya know? BUT THIS TIME? HOLY COW! What an improvement. Our room was bigger, much cleaner, and VERY quiet. The manager was extremely helpful (I had forgotten to print return directions home, and he let me use his computer to do so!), and I ABSOLUTELY recommend this place. Only a few blocks from Mag Mile, 1 block from Ed Debevic's, 2 from Hard Rock Cafe, it was perfect for me and my 3 teens.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find For Chicago-Bound Travelers”
Reviews.Author: BTCompKSU
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had to make an overnight stop in Chicago and needed to find someplace in the city that was reasonably priced. This property is in the heart of Downtown Chicago, less than 2 miles from Union Terminal. We did not have a vehicle but they are the only property in the area that offers free parking. The staff was friendly and accommodating to our late arrival. The property is set up like an apartment complex, with a double-blind key entry system (with restricted access corridors to the rooms). The room was comfortable and up to date, although for some reason the windows were fogged so no view). This property does offer free wifi and the room for elbows shower curtains. Didn't see any coffee available in the morning, but there is a cash only diner adjacent to the property that offers a variety of decent selections.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for sleep and shower”
Reviews.Author: JLSINTN
Reviews.Content: Immediate reaction, is "what a dump?" But we didn't plan on staying there except for sleep and showers since we were visiting to go to the U2 concert. Desk people were nice, but don't expect to check in early. The did hang on to our luggage before check in and check out. This is way dated. The halls smell like vomit. Room was stuffy and never got cold. Knobs are preset so can't change it. Shower wasn't great. Only mirror was in the bathroom. It wasn't bad, but I would spend a little more money next time. Location is good, expect to walk a lot. It is safe!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate- better than it looks”
Reviews.Author: AnnelieseVonSieb
Reviews.Content: This is a good place for those who want to spend a fun weekend in downtown Chicago without spending too much. I would say it is a better place for adults traveling without children, because most of those staying there when we were there (a Saturday night in summer) seemed to be there to go out to the bars, etc., and there was some noise at night from the people across the hall from us coming and going. The room was an adequate size, clean enough. The bed and pillows were not particularly comfortable & I don't think they had changed the curtains since 1974. The bathroom did seem to have been renovated more recently. The little diner/cafe at the front is your best bet for breakfast- there are not many other breakfast places in this neighborhood. There are some very good restaurants and places to go out at night nearby- just up the street there is a wonderful tapas restaurant, and a couple blues clubs with really good music are also just a couple of blocks away. The location, affordable (for downtown Chicago) price, and friendly front desk clerk were the best aspects of this place.

Reviews.Title: “It's allright”
Reviews.Author: SeenTheSights22
Reviews.Content: True. It was kinda old, but all the amenities worked except for the Wi-Fi which was absent the first 2 days of my 5 day stay. The dinner is really nice, too. The hotel provides really good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “What a dive!”
Reviews.Author: PenguinChick1979
Reviews.Content: We were very conflicted about staying in this hotel because due to the pictures on the site. It looked kinda dumpy but not too bad. Upon our arrival, we COULD NOT believe our eyes. IT WAS DISGUSTING! It was filthy, run down, unsafe looking, smelly and overall, well...disgusting! We got the key to "check out the room", sat down at the falling apart rickity table and chairs that were in the room and frantically dialed other hotels in the area to beg them for an open room for the weekend. Thank goodness the RED ROOF INN on E. Ontario St. had an open room for the weekend. If anyone on here has anything good to say about this hotel BESIDES the fact that it's close to downtown, you've got to be taking crazy pills.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE the location, but...”
Reviews.Author: SaHoppa
Reviews.Content: My husband and our 2 children spent a night here last week so we could get an early start at the Shedd Aquarium the next day. Although the rooms (we were in B1) were very small, they were very well arranged. The rooms were very clean except if you move furniture (dropped an earring) and then you might see something yellow on the wall (ewww) but who normally goes back there anyway? The water pressure was outstanding! The location was incredible - very convenient to so much really. Portillo's, Art Institute, Shedd, museums, Rock n Roll McDonalds, etc. The only issues we had were that the heater in the room was very very noisy (loud CLACK) every 30 minutes it kept the room comfortable on quite a cold night and heated up in minutes after our arrival. The front desk staff was professional and courteous. The night watchman was a little creepy. Free parking, which is a HUGE bonus in Chicago. They also had a really cute little diner attached which we didn't eat at but I'd like to try at our next stay maybe. I would describe it as "no frills but perfectly acceptable", although they DID have a blowdryer, an iron, a fridge, a coffee maker, a TV, an alarm clock, a phone, a table, little shampoos, conditioners, soaps, generous number of towels, so yeah - maybe the frills were there afterall.

Reviews.Title: “I stayed here at a historic time in Chicago Obama became the new man”
Reviews.Author: blabla1079
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel the first week of Nov at a historic time for Chicago as a stranger in town I was suprised by the quality of the hotel, having read the reviews, I expected a drug dealer to be found dead in my bath tube, but no The staff were very friendly the room was clean and the bed was large and the price was reasonable, and I must give some praise to the staff in the restaurant out front, the food was great especially the fetta omlette

Reviews.Title: “good for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: SheenL
Reviews.Content: I booked 1 night before for under 90$ it was good for the price and location. It is a short bus ride down La Salle into the Loop. The area just next to the hotel isnt the best but I still felt safe. Staff was nice and held my bags while I was in the city. Little noisy in the morning with doors closing and house keeping cleaning in the hall. Also trash pick up must be close because I heard it in the morning, If you are not a sound sleeper, it may be annoying. overall, its a good hotel, maybe should be called a motel.

Reviews.Title: “What a wreck!”
Reviews.Author: tandjchapman
Reviews.Content: The Staff was very cordial, that is where it ended. I have never stayed in a hotel that was as ill kept, run down and generally worn out as this one. If we had found another room anywhere in downtown, we would have left. Unfortunately, the town was completely booked. My daughter and grandaughter were bitten by bugs as they slept, The matresses were worn out, wallpaper peeling in the bathroom, carpets in the hallway and room were stained and worn.... I don't understand how you could have your name on the outside of the building? I have come to expect at least a moderately standard of cleanliness and upkeep...this location makes Motel 6 look like a palace.

Reviews.Title: “Love at first site!”
Reviews.Author: Meluvdehojo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I met our friends Mike and Brenda in Chicago this past weekend. I have to say for all of us that this place was like hitting the lottery. All places we checked were really expensive and we were lucky enough to find the Howard Johnson at a very reasonable rate. Location, Location, Location! We stayed there two nights and had such a great stay in Chicago. The hotel is very clean and always had that new frebreeze scent to it. Food in area is wonderful, great entertainment close by, and transportation was awesome, you just can't beat those Chicago honking cabbies. Next stop is the Ho Jo!

Reviews.Title: “Good place, central location, free parking”
Reviews.Author: zurrikk
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 2 nights. If you look for an inexpensive place at a central location, then this is the place for you. The room is your standard motel room (I booked on their website & paid only 99$/night), if a bit outdated. Parking is free, and while I was there (Thursday & Friday nights) finding a free spot was never a problem. Also, I didn't worry about safety, as the staff are watching closely who is entering the premises..

Reviews.Title: “Not for single female travellers!”
Reviews.Author: AcademicTraveller44
Reviews.Content: This hotel did not feel safe to me and, as a female travelling alone, this was important. The rooms are accessed straight from the car park - which can be accessed by anyone (not just guests) from the street. I had requested a non-smoking room, but it smelt of smoke. When I reported this, they sent someone round with an air-freshner! I promtly checked out and went and stayed somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Lower what you expect to see, save a ton of money”
Reviews.Author: cokerbud
Reviews.Content: If you have read any of my reviews over the years you know I pull no punches. Upon arrival to this property if I would have immediately written a review it would be a lot different than the one I am writing. First of all, the hotel is old and certainly dated. It is not what any of us would expect but if you just relax and give the place 24 hours it is plain to see it ain't so bad! The room was as clean as any hotel I have stayed in, the rate was one third what everything else was within 40 blocks of this property, I felt safe at all times, and there was even free parking. The hotel was a short walk to some great bars and restaurants and the staff was friendly and helpful. They did have free Wi-Fi but if you were not in certain rooms it would not work but I just walked to the lobby and did my thing. I would stay here again. It saved my company $800 bucks over two nights since there were three rooms involved. Remember, just relax and give the place a little time to grown on you.

Reviews.Title: “7 nights in Hojo”
Reviews.Author: Riza_Yosia
Reviews.Content: First time to Chicago as well as US. I went there for 7-night business. The hotel is decent, a bit old though. The bedroom is spacious with a big king size bed. The bathroom is pretty nice as well. They have a restaurant which opens in the morning up to maybe 6 PM. I tried once and it's quite good. The staffs are helpful dan courteous as far as I concern. The location is prime. It's close with train station (red, brown, and purple line), which is great for traveling. The price is quite acceptable for this hotel class. There are some problems though. The wall seems pretty thin and if you have a bad luck with noisy neighbor, it may disturb you. The AC/heater is a bit noisy. The TV is rather old but it's working properly for me. The lighting fixtures are old and unstable, but they're working and should not be an issue. All in all, it's an enjoyable experience if you plan not to spend much time in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Kinda shabby - but close to everything”
Reviews.Author: wantavacay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Howard Johnson on a recent busy weekend in Chicago, and loved that this was downtown and close to public transportation and good food, etc. The rates were a little high, but not too bad for summer in Chicago. It's great that there's parking available, and we were lucky enough to arrive at a time (around 1 p.m. on a Friday) when there were a few spots open, although the guys that came in after me didn't get a spot. (Good luck finding something nearby!) Everyone at the front desk was nice, but from the moment you walk in, you feel like you're in the 1960s. The hotel does not seem to have been updated for decades - which is kinda quaint (and probably makes it easier to snag those good rates sometimes) - but also kinda sad. Our room was a decent size, the air conditioning worked wonderfully and housekeeping was excellent. But, just getting ice or a bottle of water made for a somewhat scary walk through dimly lit, random hallways. Overall - you won't feel like you're getting a bargain here, even if you get a dicounted rate. It's just slightly shabby. But it is in a great part of town - near a subway stop and (if you're into that sort of thing) all the touristy stuff (Ed Debevic's, Hard Rock Cafe, Pizzeria Due, etc. - and Michigan Ave. shopping too).

Reviews.Title: “this is value for money”
Reviews.Author: ndekker
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel now twice, and both times enjoyed the stay. The first time was in September 2005, I was in town for a wedding and spend 3 nights in de HoJo, after that I spend 3 nights in the Intercontinental, which I regret because the HoJo is much beter value for money. Last summer i stayed again in this place, our room was small, but clean, and right next door to the cafe which serves a good breakfast! Right next door is also a good Irish pub. Anyway if I have to book a hotel again in chicago, this will be the one! Ok it is outdated, but on the other hand not as expensive [--] the rest downtown, and also a good thing you can park your car onsite for free! The staff do rent out the parking space on saturdaynight to earn some $$ themselves, so, you can forget to get your car than because the whole paking is full.

Reviews.Title: “Clean safe room for good price, nice convenient area”
Reviews.Author: lostboydp
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for the weekend, visiting some family and meeting friends for a few days. My hope was to find a decent hotel close to the downtown area I would be going to most and not be too expensive. Most hotels in the area were outragiously high (around $300 a night). I finally found the Howard Johnson, but saw mixed reviews here and at other sites. I took the chance and was pleasantly surprised. The room was clean and decently maintained. It was an older hotel, with older furnishings, but I basically wanted a clean room to sleep and shower in. And HoJo provided it! It was easlily within walking distance to Hard Rock Cafe, House of Blues, Coyote Ugly, Rock Bottom Brewery and many local restaurants. The area was nicely lit, and felt safe. And if you needed to go further around town, it was easy to get a cab. For my next trip to Chicago, this will be the first place I check for availability.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel in a safe neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: jeffssm
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the HoJo on LaSalle while in town on business, I was a bit nervous about staying there after reading all the negative comments on the hotel, but during my stay I found the hotel to be in a GREAT location, the Brehorn Pub is right around the corner and has great food and an inviting atmosphere. The hotel itself features the Cafe Luna on site, a great morning breakfast for a supreme value. I agree that the hotel does appear a bit dated on the exterior, but I found my room to be in excellent condition, appears to have had a fresh coat of paint, and updated carpeting. The doors to the rooms are located inside, so you have to use your pass card to get in, that gave me a secure feeling. But the overall area of the hotel is buzzing with activity, the Rainforest cafe and many other attractions are merely a 10 minute or so walk from the hotel. Michigan Ave. is just down the street. The L-train station is about a 3 block walk, I did it toting several pieces of luggage to get out to Midway, if going that route plan for at LEAST an hour to get to Midway you have to transfer at the Clark/Lake Street station. Only drawback I could find was the lack of internet service, there are public WiFi networks in the area but I could not get on them from the location of my room. I know its minor, with so much nightlife surrounding this place I was better off not having the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific for the money”
Reviews.Author: LittleJeff
Reviews.Content: We found it clean, the help helpful, everything satisfactory. The free parking is a big plus. If you want luxury, don't stay here--the place looks like something out of the 1950s. I'm sorry for the fellow who had a hard time finding it, but they do have street addresses in Chicago. Excellent location, by the way--easy to get everywhere you want to go. We've stayed there several times, and will continue to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: JPG4040
Reviews.Content: Our room was so dirty, we chose not to stay in it for even one night. Like the other reviewer, we also did not feel safe. Thankfully, we were there early enough to check out before we were charged - and I must say the hotel employee at the front desk was very accomodating when we told him we would not be staying. If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel in downtown Chicago, stay at the Congress Plaza. It is cheaper than the HoJo - we got a $149/night internet rate - infinitely cleaner and in a much better location. If you are worried about what you have read about the picketers, don't be, there are only 3 or 4 of them, they are off to the side, and they don't look at you or make any noise.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Mike0428
Reviews.Content: This hotel gave me exactly what I was looking for; a fairly cheap rate (as Chicago goes) which allowed me to spend my money on other things. The free parking was a real plus. Somone said that it was hard to find, I found it incredibly easy to locate, just south of Superior on Lasalle. Room was a little dingy, could use a coat of paint etc. but it was clean and in a great location. If you like spending $250 a night plus another $15 for parking for a more upscale hotel, you probably won't want to stay here. If you are looking for an inexpensive place to sleep that is in a great location and want to spend your money on the many attractions Chicago has to offer, this is a great value. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “dirty run down”
Reviews.Author: jhelcher
Reviews.Content: I am not one of those picky people. Often I stay at Motel 6. But this was one of the worst motels I've stayed at. Stayed in room d4. When I entered the hall leading to my room it stunk of urine. My wife was looking forward to taking a bath, but refused because the tub was dirty. The sink was all scratched up and stained. The dry wall between the seink and tub was rotting and mildewed from water damage. The second day I was there I had no hot water to take a shower. They couldn't tell me when it would be fixed, and their answer was to take $15 off the night. The ONLY two things it had positive was the free parking and the proximity to attarctions. Oh yah breakfast was good and reasionably priced at the Lasalle diner in front.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: pgbears
Reviews.Content: Another great stay at Howard Johnson. My girlfriend and I stayed here for a week to attend the Bears vs Falcons. Same great service. This is my third stay here with no problems. Rooms are always clean and the staff friendly. This year I had breakfast and lunch at the on site resturant and came away very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied Customer”
Reviews.Author: American_Travellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early 2005 for two nights. We found the check in staff very friendly, warm and welcoming. We had no problems with the room, it suited our needs of a place that was low on price, great location to Chicago and most of all the diner attached to the complex was fantastic. I would definitely Recommend the breakfast!!!!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE!!! Don't make the same mistake as mine...”
Reviews.Author: lelezinha
Reviews.Content: I just chose this hotel because I checked this website and it is #49 in popularity. HOW COME??? The place is AWFUL!! Smells bad, non-secure, linens are old, disgusting. The window was broken, there is no concierge and the staff cannot even indicate tourist spots. I paid USD170 per night, and I really felt stupid. The location is not that great either. There is nothing in that area at night, not even a cafeteria. I was just guided by the hotel popularity, and I did the worst possible deal in Chicago. I will never stay there again, and do not recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Free Parking & Decent Rooms”
Reviews.Author: pahhobbs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights over the 4th of July weekend last summer. We had never been to Chicago before. We are not fussy people, but like a clean place where there are some services like coffee in the a.m. The diner downstairs was so great for a quick bite so you didn't have to head out right away just to get started. You can walk to all kinds of things. If you're looking for a fancy place with lots of amenities, this should not be your choice. It's a great way to check out the city, see where you spend your time all at a reasonable price. We brought our motorcycle in our truck and unloaded it right there. We rode all over the place and left the bike in front of the truck at night. No problems at all. The rooms are old and small, but very clean and we found to be quiet. I would stay here again without reservation. We can't wait until we can return to see the stuff we couldn't get to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: Smokey596
Reviews.Content: After reading the mixed, yet mostly positive reviews of this hotel I decided to give it a try. The price was right and couldn't be beat considering the location. We were within walking distance of the Magnificent Mile as well as the free trolley stops and tons of restaurants and shops. If we couldn't walk there, we were close to the El station! The room was a little small, but clean and comfortable. It was so quiet that we thought perhaps no one else was staying there that weekend! The free and secure parking was the best feature. It was so nice to be able to leave our car in one spot for the weekend and not have to worry about it. We had breakfast at the little diner there, and it was a great value! Excellent prices for a HUGE breakfast! For someone who wants the hotel to be a part of the vacation experience, this may not be your best choice.
